h3. Issue Summary

SLA's icons layout on mobile is different than same SLA's icons on the web
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Open issue, check SLA icons
 # Check same issue's SLA icons on web

h3. Expected Results

Icons are consistent
h3. Actual Results

Icons mismatch
h3. Workaround

No workaround is required - purely UI issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Given issue has transition screen between statuses, there may be situation when transition screen doesn't contain assignee and/or comment fields. Issue still can be moved between statuses
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to the system as an agent user, open JSD project 
 # Open issue with transition screen set (e.g. Service Request)
 # Move issue between statuses

h3. Expected Results

Per project configuration screen contains comment field and assignee field
h3. Actual Results

An empty "Transition" screen is displayed with only "Back" and "Save" buttons.
h3. Workaround

Assignee and Comment can be added after transition is done. In some cases user can tap Back button and try to change status again and in this case transition screen will be displayed correctly.
fields.summary: Issue Transition: Transition screen is empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

All recent users agents who you've mentioned in comments or the customer reporting the issue are listed as possible assignees. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to the system as an agent user, open JSD project 
 # Tap on assignee field, try to search for another agent assigned to current project

h3. Expected Results

Only agents assigned to current project are displayed
h3. Actual Results

Any agent's username who was beforehand mentioned in comments or the customer reporting the issue is in the search results. If user try to select them, error message will be displayed
h3. Workaround

No workaround required - purely UI issue, as backend doesn't allow to assign issue to user without proper permissions
fields.summary: Assign user: All recent users are listed as possible assignees

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an agent tries to link an issue - session times-out (401 status code is received)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in as an Agent, open JSD project
 # Open any issue and tap on "more" button
 # select "Add issue link" option on the pop-up
 # Find issue with type "Support" and tap "Add"

h3. Expected Results

User is able to link Support ticket to the issue
h3. Actual Results

User receives "Session Timed out" message and is logged out after pressing "OK" button. 
h3. Workaround

Link Support issues from web
fields.summary: Agent 's attempt to link support issue leads to "session time-out"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Collaborator or restricted user (without permissions to assign issue) is able to open "Assignee selector" screen, even though they have no permissions to change the assignee (backend returns an error)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to the system as a user with collaborator role
 # Open JSD project 
 # Tap on any issue and on issue screen tap on assignee button

h3. Expected Results

User with restricted rights (e.g. collaborator) can't open assignee change field - it should be read only
h3. Actual Results

User can open assignee change field and try to assign user.
h3. Workaround

As action is resrticted - error from backend is returned and no assignment happens, so user can't perform action.
fields.summary: Issue detail screen: collaborator is able to select an assignee

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently the SLA documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/setting-up-slas-939926373.html) states "The SLA status is only recalculated for open issues, not for resolved issues."

SLAs are actually recalculated regardless of the issue status.

SLAS are NOT recalculated only if the SLA itself is stopped.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change SLA goal

h3. Expected Results
"The SLA status is only recalculated for SLAs running, not for stopped SLAs."

h3. Actual Results
"The SLA status is only recalculated for open issues, not for resolved issues."

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: SLA recalculation documentation is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for and then viewing a KB in the Customer Portal, pressing *Back to results* results in the search term show with special "HTML Entity" characters present. For example, spaces turn to %20, commas turn to %2C, and so on.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Confluence to JIra
 # Setup a KB link to Confluence, and create a test KB with the title including a space
 # Open the customer portal
 # Under _what do you need help with_, enter the name of the KB article
 # Click the KB article title to view it
 # click *Back to results*

h3. Expected Results

The search term displays without weird characters
h3. Actual Results

The search term displays with weird characters. EG, spaces turn to %20

!image-2020-09-25-13-54-52-355.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: On the customer portal, KB search term is shown with HTML entity characters (not unescaped)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have noticed this behaviour when Jira is running with JRE 1.8.0_144.

***_No installed provider supports this key: javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec_* error message may appear when trying to save configuration for Opsgenie or Confluence Cloud integrations.

!Screen Shot 2020-09-24 at 3.35.29 pm.jpg|width=565,height=511!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Confluence Cloud integration or Opsgenie integration menu
 # Fill the form with valid data
 # Click Save button

h3. Expected Results

Integration enabled
h3. Actual Results

Error mentioned above appears. Integration cannot be set up.
h3. Workaround
 # Stop Jira
 # Upgrade your JRE to 1.8.0_202 or higher
 # Start Jira
fields.summary: Setting up OpsGenie or Confluence Cloud integration may fail on some java versions

Executing the query below should return the default value for the column SUBJECT: VARCHAR(255)
{code:java}

fields.description:
We notice the Jira Service Desk Cloud team Updated SLA REST API in order to "The friendly value inside of the remaining time, goalDuration and elapsed time objects will now use additional time units - days ("d"), weeks ("w") and years ("y")."
We checked this news here: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/

We would like to request this for Jira Service Desk Server REST API as well, and if possible to also have it available at https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/4.0.0/com/atlassian/servicedesk/api/sla/info/SlaInformationService.DurationFormatter.html.
fields.summary: Bring additional time units to SLA in REST and Java API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching on the help centre (portal of portals) if there are projects links to knowledge bases on Confluence server with space keys which match CQL keywords like 'AND', 'OR', 'NOT' the search will return no results. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD instance with an application link to confluence server
 # Create multiple spaces on the confluence instance, of which one should have the space key 'AND'
 # Link multiple projects to created spaces
 # Search on the help centre and observe that no results are returned for matching searches
 # Unlink the 'AND' space and the search will work

h3. Expected Results

Should search across all spaces, including those with CQL reserved words. 
h3. Actual Results

No results are returned from the searches
h3. Workaround

Only way around this is to unlink the space and create a space that does not have a space key as a reserved CQL word.
fields.summary: Searching with knowledge base links with space keys that are CQL keywords fails to return results on the help centre

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images attached as a part of 'canned response' is not loading when it is retrieved for different issues. Only saved text is seen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Jira Service Desk Project. Go to any issues > Canned responses > Add a response with image (Test) > Save it. You would be able to retrieve the image from canned response in the same issue.
 # Go to any other issue > Canned responses > Test. You would see image will not be rendered.
# Go to Canned responses > Test > Edit. The saved image from step 1 will not be rendered in saved response also. 

h3. Expected Results
Images getting rendered/displayed along with saved strings/characters for all issues.

h3. Actual Results
Images are getting rendered for only the issues on which canned response was saved originally. Images are not getting rendered on other issues. Only the text is seen. 

h3. Workaround
No workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachments/Images are not getting retrieved in canned responses

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since Jira Service Desk 4.12, support to connect mail channels to Office 365 accounts using OAuth 2.0 has been introduced. However, it doesn't support GCC (Government Community Cloud) accounts.

It isn't supported because regular Office 365 accounts connect to {{outlook.office365.com}} whilst GCC accounts connect to {{outlook.office365.us}}.

Therefore, the connection is not established and the mail channel can't be connected using OAuth 2.0

h3. Workaround

Manually update the hosts file of the operating system to point to the US domain. However, doing this will remove the automatic failover to a new IP address in case of outages in the primary IP address.

Example:
{code}
40.66.16.130 outlook.office365.com
{code}
fields.summary: Office 365 using OAuth 2.0 doesn't support GCC customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Could you please consider adding a way to manage how frequently a watched Service Desk queue gets updated. I believe any update to the issues in the queue can force an update, however, if this is a particularly active queue watched by many agents this can result in a huge number of requests being made to Jira every second. We are currently handling 50+ requests a second on our Jira Server, many of which are due to queue refreshes. This causes a huge and unnecessary load on our server. Just being able to limit a queue refresh for a user to once every 10 seconds say would probably halve the load on our server.
fields.summary: Service Desk Queue Refresh Rate

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to check the profile of a user (e.g project lead or any other user) from the "Users & roles" page, the hyperlinks use "/jira" context path instead of the one defined in Tomcat, therefore the page leads to a dead link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In server.xml, set up Jira to use a custom context path (e.g /jira881)
 # Restart Jira for the change to take effect.
 # Create a JSD project
 # Under _Project Settings > Users & Roles, t_he project lead should be defined by default to the project creator. You may also change it manually and add users to the project roles.
 # Under _Project Settings > Users & Roles_, click on *Project Lead* or any other user on that page.

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to see the user's profile and the page should open 
 *<Base_URL>*/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
h3. Actual Results

The click leads to a dead link since it opens *<Hostname>/jira*/secure/ViewProfile.jspa.
 Note that the base URL changed to *<Hostname>/jira* which should be hardcoded somewhere in the code.
 !ProjectLead.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wrong context path in ViewProfile URL in "Users & roles" page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira Core 8.12 onwards, the AUI was upgraded to version 9, as can be verified on [Preparing for Jira 8.12|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/preparing-for-jira-8-12-1014677903.html]. 

This change broke the Service Desk account signup when public signup is allowed, if a *Password Policy* is enabled and if *Email Verification* is required for signups.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Install Jira Core 8.12 and Jira Service Desk 4.12
 # Enable public signup on Jira by going to *Cog > Applications > _Jira Service Desk_ Configuration*
 # Enable the *Email Verification* for new signups -- this requires a working outgoing mail server
 # Go to *Cog > System > Password Policy* and enable a password policy (e.g *Secure*
 # Try creating a new account by opening an Incognito window and navigating to {{<BASE-URL>/servicedesk/customer/user/signup}}

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to create new customer accounts.

h3. Actual Results

The window is blank:

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-17 at 19.36.03.png|thumbnail! 

In the browser console the error below can be observed:

{code}
batch.js?locale=en-US:1627 Uncaught Invariant Violation: Minified React error #200; visit https://reactjs.org/docs/error-decoder.html?invariant=200 for the full message or use the non-minified dev environment for full errors and additional helpful warnings. 
{code}

h3. Workaround

Disable either:

 # A password policy enforcement or
 # Disable email verification requirement for new accounts
fields.summary: Public signup page breaks if password policy and email verification are enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Service Desk request is approved, the following section is added to the request on the portal view:
(SDS-53760.png)(SDS-53760_status translation.png)
The status on the Approval section within the portal view of an issues does not get correctly translated based on the status translation set for any of the sections.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the "Statuses" configuration in Jira > Add a translation for the workflow statuses for a language of choice (mainly the status of the approval stage).
# Create a Service Desk request that has an approval step
# Approve the Service Desk request
# Open this request from the customer portal
# Change the language of the customer who is viewing the request from the portal to a language with the translated status.

*Expected Results*
The status found on the approval section should reflect the correct translation set.

*Actual Results*
The status is not translated in the Approval section on the ticket. While the status is translated correctly in the activity section.
For example: "Waiting for support" status is not translated:


*Workaround*
None
fields.summary: Statuses in the Approval section on the portal view are not translated to selected language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When working with *Service Request with Approval* issues, during the *Pending Approval phase*, Jira will be waiting for the necessary approvals to be provided before moving into the next stage.
 However, if for any reason the request is moved to another stage before all the necessary approvals are provided (e.g. with automation to automatically close requests that have not been approved inside a specific SLA), the *Past Approvals* section will be hidden from the UI.

This is especially impactful when there is more than one approval that must be provided for a specific request, as it will not be possible to visualize on the UI who approved the request, and from whom the approval was pending.

*Note:* By moving the issue back into the "Waiting for Approval" state, the section will be added back to the UI, and the approvals that had already been granted will still remain present.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using any workflows that have a Pending for Approval stage, add a direct transition from this status to a different one.
 # Create a Service Request with Approvals
 # While it is waiting for the approvals to be provided, move the request to a different status (and In Progress or Final status will work).

*Pending Approvals:*
 !1-PendingApproval.png|thumbnail!

*After the premature transition:*
 !2-AutoCancelled.png|thumbnail! 
 !3-AutoResolved.png|thumbnail!

*Transition after all the approvals are granted:*
 !4-ExpectedBehavior.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The "Past Approvals" should be kept.
h3. Actual Results

The "Past Approvals" is hidden from the UI (but the information remains available on the backend).
h3. Workaround

In case you need to view the information from the *Past Approvals* section on the UI, you may transition the issue back to the Waiting for Approval state. 
 (i) If you wish, you may even complete the necessary approvals on this state, and the issue will proceed to the next stage while the *Past Approvals will be maintained*.

You can also visualize who provided their approval directly on the database using the query below (while checking the 'TEST-123' by an actual issue key):
{code:sql}
SELECT apl."ID", CONCAT(prj.pkey, '-', jis.issuenum) AS IssueKey, apd."DECISION" AS Decision, app.lower_user_name AS Approver
FROM "AO_56464C_APPROVAL" apl
JOIN "AO_56464C_APPROVERDECISION" apd ON apl."ID" = apd."APPROVAL_ID"
JOIN app_user app ON apd."USER_KEY" = app.user_key
JOIN jiraissue jis ON jis.id = apl."ISSUE_ID"
JOIN project prj ON prj.id = jis.project
WHERE CONCAT(prj.pkey, '-', jis.issuenum) = 'TEST-123';
{code}
fields.summary: Past Approvals section is hidden if the request is prematurely moved to another state

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Cloud integration doesn't allow customers to view knowledge base articles on customer portal/issue view/etc. Because of strict politics & restrictions in Safari, related to `X-Frame-Options` and [recently released|https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safari-release-notes/safari-13_1-release_notes] cookie politics, it blocks iframe usage for displaying KBI articles.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Confluence Cloud integration
 # Add KB space for a project in the project settings
 # Open request creation form on the customer portal
 # or open dialog with KB article from the issue view

h3. Expected Results

Should display KB article
h3. Actual Results

KB article iframe blocked by safari with console error.

`Refused to display 'iframe-host-placeholder' in a frame because it set 'X-Frame-Options' to 'SAMEORIGIN'.`
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior, although you can use any other browser, except Safari. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud KBI articles are blocked by `X-Frame-Options` in Safari

h3. Issue Summary

JSD currently only supports IMAP for Microsoft when authenticating using OAuth 2.0. Support should also be enabled for POP. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Microsoft client configurations in the OAuth 2.0 plugin
 # Navigate to Email requests within a JSD project
 # Select Microsoft and currently only IMAP is supported

h3. Expected Results

Ability to also use the POP protocol. 
h3. Actual Results

The drop down in JSD will only display IMAP - this has been deliberately disabled due the POP authentication protocol which Microsoft has adopted not being being supported in the Java mail library.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JSD automation webhooks appear to be executed with no defined socket timeouts (note, this is a different implementation from the core Jira). Consequently, a poorly behaving receiver can prevent JSD automation webhooks from being sent, as *PsmqAsyncExecutors-then* threads become stuck in the following stack:
{noformat}
java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
  at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
  at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
  at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:171)
  at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)
  at org.apache.http.impl.io.SessionInputBufferImpl.streamRead(SessionInputBufferImpl.java:137)
  at org.apache.http.impl.io.SessionInputBufferImpl.fillBuffer(SessionInputBufferImpl.java:153)
  at org.apache.http.impl.io.SessionInputBufferImpl.readLine(SessionInputBufferImpl.java:282)
  at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultHttpResponseParser.parseHead(DefaultHttpResponseParser.java:138)
  at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultHttpResponseParser.parseHead(DefaultHttpResponseParser.java:56)
  at org.apache.http.impl.io.AbstractMessageParser.parse(AbstractMessageParser.java:259)
  at org.apache.http.impl.DefaultBHttpClientConnection.receiveResponseHeader(DefaultBHttpClientConnection.java:163)
  at org.apache.http.impl.conn.CPoolProxy.receiveResponseHeader(CPoolProxy.java:165)
  at org.apache.http.protocol.HttpRequestExecutor.doReceiveResponse(HttpRequestExecutor.java:273)
  at org.apache.http.protocol.HttpRequestExecutor.execute(HttpRequestExecutor.java:125)
  at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.execute(MainClientExec.java:272)
  at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.ProtocolExec.execute(ProtocolExec.java:185)
  at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RetryExec.execute(RetryExec.java:89)
  at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RedirectExec.execute(RedirectExec.java:111)
  at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:185)
  at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:83)
  at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:108)
  at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:56)
  at com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.webhook.executor.WebhookExecutorImpl.executeWebhook(WebhookExecutorImpl.java:91)
{noformat}
** Note the flow: WebhookExecutorImpl.executeWebhook -> CloseableHttpClient.execute -> SessionInputBufferImpl.streamRead -> SocketInputStream.socketRead0
* Other *PsmqAsyncExecutors-then* threads are stuck in waiting for a HTTP connection from the pool, since they all use the same pool:
{noformat}
java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking) at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method) - parking to wait for <0x000000000496db71> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject) 
  at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175) 
  at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039) 
  at org.apache.http.pool.AbstractConnPool.getPoolEntryBlocking(AbstractConnPool.java:380)
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Challenging to reproduce, but you can mimic a misbehaving receiver by configuring a [tarpit|https://www.eanderalx.org/linux/iptables_as_tarpit]. 

h3. Expected Results
The connection should timeout after being stuck in SocketRead() for some time.

h3. Actual Results
The connection never seems to be closed when a receiver is misbehaving and not terminating the connection from its end.

h3. Workaround
* Restart Jira to unblock the *PsmqAsyncExecutors-then* thread
* Currently there is no known workaround without downtime for this behavior.
fields.summary: JSD automation webhooks are not being sent due to no socket timeout defined

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JSD mail handler is unable to check more than one single message ID by looking at the source code of the incoming e-mail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* in a JSD project configure a mail handler
* in the same JSD project add a property to the Closed status workflow to deny edit/comment of the issue after closure
* create a new ticket by mailing the JSD mail handler address
* after doing that transition the issue to Closed
* reply to the 1st mail sent to create the issue which is now closed
* at this point JSD mail handler code look into the *In-Reply-To* and *References* headers and will find the match with *message ID* of the original message in the *In-Reply-To*. At this point it will attempt to add a comment to the original message but this will fail as the workflow contains the property which deny the comment. So JSD mail handler will create another new ticket.
* now reply again to the same mail message. The expected behaviour now should be that the mail handler is going to add a comment to the 2nd ticket (which is not in the closed status) since the *message ID* which is into the *In-Reply-To* match the 2nd issue created *message ID*. Instead it creates another new ticket. And that's because the *messageID* of the original message is still into the References header and Jira check only one time trying to match the lowest ID.

h3. Expected Results
the JSD mail handler should check all the headers for any matching message ID
h3. Actual Results
the JSD mail handler only seems to check the lowest message ID into the mail source headers

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSD mail handler check only one message ID into the mail source headers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the Jira Service Desk automation it is possible to setup an action of sending a webhook. However the available fields in which you can choose to add as part of the webhook payload is very limited to a predefined list. Currently as of 4.11, you can only choose the following fields:
 * Recipient Name
 * Portal name
 * Name of person who caused the action
 * Issue summary
 * Issue description
 * Issue key
 * Issue reporter
 * Issue resolution
 * Request URL
 * Request status
 * Request details.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for all issue fields (both system fields and custom fields) to be included in the json payload of that automation webhook.
h3. Why this is important

This is already possible in Jira Cloud, due to the integration of codebarrel automation across all projects. This is important because the current state greatly limits the ability to integrate JSD server with other 3rd party products.
h3. Workaround

The [Automation for Jira Server plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira-server?hosting=server&tab=overview] (Full version, not Lite) is able to do send webhooks as an automation action.  Also you can use [Smart values|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/what-are-smart-values/] in that automation rule in order to select any field in the issue to be included as part of the json payload.
fields.summary: Service Desk automation action to send webhooks should be able to include system and custom fields in the payload

fields.description:
We use  dynamic forms or we use straight up forms and we like for our project managers to be able to adjust help text in their request forms rather than logging to service desk to do it.

The project manager may adjust the display name of a field or adjust the help text. We strongly admonish them if they change the required field.

The problem is the required field flips from Yes to No.   All the person did was adjust the help text.  

This now causes problems when using the form.  So if a person is not noticing that the required column flips, their request intake will have required fields turned to optional.

The PM then thinks there is a program failure and logs a support ticket. We ask what did they maintain.  Each time it has been to only adjust the display name or help text.

This should never happen.  The required status should stay as it is.
fields.summary: Request Type > Edit Fields > Modify help text changes required flag

fields.description:
Currently requests can be considered approved after all approvers approve it or a specific number of approvers do it.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Administrators can create custom listeners to respond to events fired by Jira, per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/listeners-938846909.html].

When such a listener is used to transition a Jira Service Desk issue in response to an event, and that transition is responsible for changing the SLA state of the issue, the issue will remain in the original SLA state, rather than the new state for the new status.

This is due to a race condition between how the listener handles an event (i.e. the CommentCreatedEvent) earlier than when Jira Service Desk itself does, which results in Jira Service Desk returning the SLA state to the old state which is incorrect for the new status.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Unknown. Allow for Jira Service Desk to recognize that a transition has occurred prior to it's own event handling.
fields.summary: SLA is placed in an incorrect state when a custom listener transitions an issue that changes the SLA state

h3. Issue Summary

Service Desk webhooks that fail because of whitelist or execution failure still indicate success on the UI

 # Create a webhook using SD native automation.
 # Make sure the whitelist is enabled.
 # Verify the URL used in the webhook is not whitelisted.
 # Trigger the webhook in the SD automation.

h3. Expected Results

The triggering of the webhook will fail due to the whitelist and the automation will register it as a FAILURE.
h3. Actual Results

The webhooks fail silently, and the automation marks SUCCESS. When enabling the webhooks package *com.atlassian.webhooks* in debug level ** a warning with the failure of the webhook appears:
{code:java}
2020-08-04 23:16:36,204+0800 PsmqAsyncExecutors-then:thread-4 WARN rene 1396x1461x1 e4m615 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/issue/10044/comment [c.a.s.p.a.i.e.engine.asyncthen.AsyncThenJobProcessor] Failed executing ThenAction com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.webhook.rulethen.WebhookThenAction asynchronously: 'Invalid URL, not permitted by the system whitelist'{code}
 * This issue seems to have started in SD 4.6 when there was a change made to the whitelist, according to [Jira Service Desk webhooks|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/jira-service-desk-webhooks/]

h3. Workaround

Make sure the webhook URL is added to the whitelist.
fields.summary: Service Desk webhooks that fail indicate success

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the option to manage organization Jira Service Desk is defined in this question: _Can agents manage organizations?_
* Yes, agents can add and remove organizations from projects, and add and remove customers from organizations
* No, only Jira administrators can manage organizations

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide more options to manage organization in Jira Service Desk similar to permission scheme options. For example:
|| Permission || Granted to ||
| Create organization | * Project Role
* Application access
* Group
* Single user
* Project lead | 
| Delete organization | * Project Role
* Application access
* Group
* Single user
* Project lead | 

h3. Why this is important
This allows a more defined permission on managing organization. 

An example use case would be:
* Agents can add organizations but cannot delete organizations. This prevents accidental deletion of organizations created by other agents
* Jira administrators can add and delete organizations
fields.summary: Refine organization management in Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description

In Service Desk 4.11.0, we introduced the language support feature described in [Providing help in multiple languages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/providing-help-in-multiple-languages-1014679294.html].

The page to configure the language support is broken when Service Desk is installed from the page *⚙ > Applications > Versions & Licenses* (or by uploading the Service Desk OBR file):
- the name of the page shows as "sd.project.language.support.tab.label" (instead of "Language support")
- when clicking on this page, the page does not load (it spins forever), and the following error is shown:
{code}
sd.lingo.error.unknown
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Install Jira Software (or Jira Core) 8.11.0 by using the installer from [this page|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download]
# After Jira 8.11.0 is installed, go to the page *⚙ > Applications > Versions & Licenses*
# Click on "Try it for free" under Service Desk to install it
# Add a license to Service Desk
# Create a new Service Desk project
# Go to the Service Desk Project Setting page


h3. Expected results

- the language support page should be called "Language Support"
- when clicking on it, the page should open

 !Bug_afterFix.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results

- the name of the page shows as "sd.project.language.support.tab.label" (instead of "Language support")
- when clicking on this page, the page does not load (it spins forever), and the following error is shown:
{code}
sd.lingo.error.unknown
{code}

 !Bug_beforeFix.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

The workaround consists in manually uploading the lingo integration jar file which was missing from the Service Desk OBR file.

The steps are:
# Download the JAR file from this ticket  [^servicedesk-lingo-integration-plugin-4.11.0-REL-0008.jar] 
# Go to *⚙ > Manage Apps > Manage Apps*
# Click on *Upload app*, and upload the JAR file downloaded from this ticket
# Go back to the Service Desk project setting page, and you should now be able to see the *Language Support* page
fields.summary: The Language Support page introduced in Service Desk 4.11.0 does not load

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In a JSD Workflow, it is possible to configure a transition to be made available to customers in the Customer Portal. It is additionally possible to configure that transition to set or clear a Resolution value.

It is also possible to configure a custom post-function in a transition (provided by the *Jira Suite Utilities* or *Scriptrunner* third party add-ons for example) to clear an issue's resolution upon the transition being executed.

If both of these are configured for the same transition, the resolution clearing functionality will be redundant between the third-party postfunction and JSD's own capability. When this transition is executed from the customer portal, the following problems will occur:
* Even though the resolution will be cleared, the issue history does not record the change.
* If any SLA conditions are to be triggered by "Resolution: Cleared", they will not occur. By default, the "Time to Resolution" SLA will not be restarted as expected when this happens.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Add a feature to JSD to account for a third party postfunction clearing the resolution
* Add a warning to JSD if a third party postfunction that will clear the resolution is detected
 
h3. Workaround 

Either one or the other mechanism of clearing the resolution will work alone. If the customer must be able to perform the transition, consider removing one or the other, depending on if the Workflow is to be used in any other non-JSD context.
fields.summary: Clearing resolution using third party postfunction in workflow transition can break Issue History and SLAs

fields.description:
I'd like a way to *move comments* from one jira ticket to another so that the comments are transferred to the new ticket *with the original sender and timestamp* still attached to each comment.

This is especially needed for *Jira Service Desk***.  When users send report requests, they often keep replying to the same email over and over, with multiple, unrelated requests.  If this happens, you end up with a monster ticket containing a plethora of components and comments, which should actually be several different tickets, each with only a few comments.

The proposed *Move* option would be found on a comment, e.g., an arrow icon near the trash bin and other icons you use to take action on the comment.  Upon clicking *Move*, you would be able to enter or search for a ticket to move the comment into (similar to creating a link from one ticket to another).

There would also need to be permissions to set for users who have access to the project, e.g., "move own comments" and "move any comments".
fields.summary: Move comments from one jira ticket into another (Jira Server)

fields.description:
When submitting comments in Service Desk, the "Share with Customer" button is prominent whereas the "Comment Internally" button is relatively less so.

I'd like to suggest this be reverse so that the "Comment Internally" button is the more prominent, perhaps also switching their places.  Also, "Comment Internally" should be the default submit for those who do everything via keyboard. 

This would minimise accidentally making a private comment public, which is something you cannot "undo" as as an email update is also sent to the customer.... and the impact of this can potentially be quite severe.

If we reverse this, and it's more often that public comments are accidentally made private, this is very easy to remedy: you just republish the comment as "Share with customer".  Additionally, internal comments already have a label on them, making them easy to identify.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On an iPhone, clicking "Approve" button in an email will open a mobile web browser. On Safari mobile browser you will see the blank page. Chrome or Edge mobile browsers are behaving correctly. Request path in Safari looks like:
{code:java}
<JIRA URL>/servicedesk/customer/user/approval-action/<issue ID>/155/undefined/rest/webResources/1.0/resources
{code}
Request path in Chrome or Edge looks like:
{code:java}
<JIRA URL>/rest/webResources/1.0/resources
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the "Approve" button in an email on an iPhone.
 # Clicking the "Approve" button will open a mobile web browser.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA page will load in the mobile web browser and approval will be processed.
h3. Actual Results

Safari mobile web browser shows the blank page. Chrome or Edge mobile browsers are behaving correctly.
 !mobile-safari-blank.png|width=65,height=141!
h3. Workaround

Enabling the "HTTP access log" in JIRA causes the Safari mobile browser to use "<JIRA URL>/rest/webResources/1.0/resources". When Safari uses this request path the page loads correctly.
fields.summary: Clicking the "Approve" button in an email on an iPhone will open a blank page in Safari mobile browser

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For a JSD that uses the local directory and built-in login form, if a user leaves their browser open and takes no action (maintaining a browser session, but not a Jira session), the next action they take (e.g., clicking a link) will result in a redirect to one of JSD’s login pages, but the page will not render, resulting in a blank page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_To reproduce these steps faster, set Jira’s {{session-timeout}} to some small value, like 1 or 2 minutes._
 # Log into an instance of Jira Service Desk (e.g. “/servicedesk/customer/portals”); at the login screen, do _not_ check the “Keep me logged in” checkbox
 # Access some part of Jira Service Desk (an issue view, portal view, etc.)
 # Wait for Jira’s session to expire (optionally, keep an eye on Jira’s security log to know the session has been destroyed)
 # Click a link or refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

User should be redirected to a JSD login page; the login form should render, allowing the user to log back in.
h3. Actual Results

*Short version:* The user is redirected to the JSD login page, but an error in the rendering of the page results prevents the login form itself from rendering; instead, the user sees a blank page.

*Long version / theory:*
 # The user is redirected to the JSD login page
 # Since the user’s browser session hasn’t ended, their browser will still hold the previous session’s {{JSESSIONID}} cookie, and will send that cookie in the initial set of requests to the login page
 # Some of those requests will be to the _/rest/webResources/1.0/resources_ endpoint; this endpoint responds with a 401 when an invalid {{JSESSIONID}} is sent, but the endpoint itself – at least for requests from the login page / for assets required for the login page – doesn’t actually require a Jira session to return a successful response
 # The responses returned by _/rest/webResources/1.0/resources_ are crucial to the continued rendering of the page; once that endpoint responds with a 401, further rendering of the page is blocked, resulting in the blank page

It seems like this is, at some level, a Javascript race condition – in my attempts to grab a screen recording of this bug, I found that I couldn’t reproduce the bug while trying to record the screen, while every attempt to reproduce while the screen _wasn’t_ being recorded resulted in the flow described above.
h3. Workaround

Users can get around this issue by clearing their cookies or restarting their browser (or taking whatever steps are necessary for their particular browser for the current _browser_ session cookies to be considered "expired").

If the JSD service is behind a load balancer or other traffic manager which supports scripting and supports modifying requests before forwarding, such a script can be written which removes the {{JSESSIONID}} when:
 # the HTTP method is POST
 # the request path is _*/rest/webResources/1.0/resources_
 # the referer is one of JSD’s login pages (e.g. _*/servicedesk/customer/*/login*_)
fields.summary: Allowing Jira session to expire without closing browser window can result in redirect to blank page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a notification generated by a Software issue is forwarded to a JIRA Service Desk (JSD) email channel account, the original Software issue is updated with a comment rather than a new JSD ticket being opened.
h5. Background

This is considered expected behavior because the handler/channel is processing the incoming mail [based on Message ID|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-jira-updates-issues-from-email-611812070.html]. There are many business use-case scenarios where this behavior is undesirable.
h3. Suggested Solution

If a Software email notification is forwarded to a JSD email channel account and does not include the Software issue key in the Subject line, the incoming message should be processed as a new JSD issue.
h3. Workaround

There are two workarounds:
 # Copy/Paste the contents of the Software notification into a new message and send to the JSD email channel.
 # Create a new issue in the JSD project, then change the Subject line to reflect the new JSD issue key before forwarding the email notification.
fields.summary: JSD email channels should process incoming mail as a new JSD issue if no issue key is in the Subject line

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When a customer who does not have access to a Service Desk request (by not being the reporter or a participant) adds a comment to this request by email (after enabling the setting *Public email comments*), none of the following condition in an Automation rule is verified:
 - User is an agent
 - User is not an agent
 - User is a customer
 - User is not a customer

Instead, only the following condition is verified:
 - User has no access


This type of behavior can be very confusing for our customers who are configuring Automation rules, because the way these conditions are verified is not clear and not documented anywhere.

Since the user from the test does not hold a JSD license, and is not part of the "Service Desk Team" role, we would think that the condition "User is not an agent" should be verified. However, this condition is not verified, and could cause confusion to our customers.

h3. Suggestion

Provide clear documentation on how each of the 5 following condition is validated when an automation rule is triggered:
 - User is an agent
 - User is not an agent
 - User is a customer
 - User is not a customer
 - User has no access
fields.summary: Ability to Clone Individual Automation Rules Needed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
workflows statuses shown to customer in the portal are duplicated with german language translation

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*   Create a Jira Service Desk project
*   Set Jira system language and indexing language to German
*  in the JSD project go to Request types, edit fields, workflow statuses and change a status translation so that it show the same as another existing status. Example set the *pending* and *waiting for support* statuses so that they show *In progress* from the customer perspective in the portal as well as the *In progress* status:
 !Screenshot 2020-07-07 at 10.36.27.png|thumbnail! 
* raise a ticket from the portal
* from Jira internally transition the ticket first from waiting for support to in progress, then from in progress to pending
* observe that in the portal the customer *see 2 times the same transition* in the *activity section* In progress (*in arbeit* in german) while he should see no status changing since when he raised the issue was first in waiting for support (translated as in progress/in arbeit), then to in progress (translated as in progress/in arbeit), then in pending (translated as in progress/in arbeit):
 !Screenshot_2020-07-07_at_10_38_17.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Jira should not show any change in transitioning on the portal. The internal transitioning should be not triggered and shown to customer. 
h3. Actual Results
While the status name is always in arbeit the customer see activity changes.
h3. Workaround
* switch the *Jira default language* and the user profile language back to *English*, go to *Request types settings, edit fields, workflows statuses*, manually add the *In arbeit* translation to the *in progress* , which is the one Jira should translate by itself.
 !Screenshot 2020-07-07 at 11.01.37.png|thumbnail! 
* go to the customer portal, raise a new ticket and observe that while transitioning the issue from Waiting for Support to in progress and then to pending from Jira internally, the customer does't see any change in the activity and status always remain *In arbeit* as it should be.
 !Screenshot 2020-07-07 at 11.01.15.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-07-07 at 11.00.57.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: workflows statuses shown to customer in the portal are duplicated in the activity section with german language set

{quote}
The request type search will display a maximum of 5 results, and:

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When a customer who does not have access to a Service Desk request (by not being the reporter or a participant) adds a comment to this request by email (after enabling the setting *Public email comments*), the following condition (from automation rules) is not validated, even if the user is not an agent within the Service Desk project:
- User is not an agent

Instead, only the following condition is verified:
 - User has no access

It is because the "User is not an agent" Condition is verified using the following logic:
- the user does not have a Service Desk license, or is not granted the *Browse Project* and the *Service Desk Agents* project permissions
- and the user is not an outsider (the user did not add a comment to a request they don't have access to by email)

This type of behavior can be very confusing for our customers who are configuring Automation rules, because the way these conditions are verified is not clear and not documented anywhere.

Since the user from the test does not hold a JSD license, and is not part of the "Service Desk Team" role, we would think that the condition "User is not an agent" should be verified. However, this condition is not verified, and could cause confusion to our customers.

h3. Suggestion

Modify the implementation of the "User is not an agent" condition, so that it can be verified than an "outsider" adds a comment by email to a request they don't have access.
fields.summary: Improve the way the "User is not an agent" condition is validated

fields.description:
At the moment there's no documentation available about how the *sorting of My request* actually work in the customer portal.

By default request are ordered from recent to the oldest one with a different logic setup if the user browsing the portal is an agent or a customer.

The Agent view is governed by the JQL used to construct the queue (internally).

The Customer view’s issue are sorted by *lastUpdated/creation* timestamps.

Therefore requests are sorted in My requests from the recent ones (edited) to the oldest one edited and with the following exceptions:
 * if the issue has been *resolved* by myself (me as a customer user), then at refresh in Any status filter *it will not appear on top*.
 * if the issue instead has been *resolved* or *closed* in Jira *internally* by the *agent*, then after refreshing the page and filtering again by Any Status, *you will see this issue on top*.

Please provide documentation about this behaviour.
fields.summary: Document the behaviour of My request sorting in the customer portal

 # Create a new JSD project with email request

 # Setup a customer account (cust) and a agent account (agent)
 # Login to customer portal as cust
 # Create a new request and assign agent as the Assignee
 # Agent update the issue from Jira (comment with attachment), triggering notification to cust
 ** cust replies to the notification with new attachment - watch for the JSD update and agent notification
 ** cust replies to the last notification with no attachment - watch for the JSD update and agent notification

h3. Expected Results

!Screen Shot 2020-06-23 at 1.33.55 pm.png|width=715,height=476!

Message metadata for attachments:

!Screen Shot 2020-06-22 at 12.22.51 pm.png!

1) the addition of a column in the attachment detail view listing the visibility of the attachment (internal / customer)

2) a column in the attachment detail with the user which added the attachment (to differentiate between customers and internal agents)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, any users who do not have application access, will be treated as Service Desk customer, which is mentioned in [Jira Service Desk: Agents, Customers, and Roles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-agents-customers-and-roles]. Hence being directed to Customer Portal. 

This is not ideal for some customers as users without application access are not necessarily meant to be Service Desk customers, especially if the user access JIRA via baseURL (and not the customer portal URL).

This automatic redirection may confused users who are are not mean to be part of Service Desk in the first place.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option on handling users without application access:
* Those users who do not have application access, but accessing JIRA using its baseURL should remain on JIRA side, and prompted with a message:
{quote}
You do not have access to any project or You do not have application access.
{quote}
* While those users who do not have application access, and accessing JIRA using customer portal URL should remain on Service Desk side.
fields.summary: Having the option to handle users without application access

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

h3. Issue Summary

If an incoming mail meant to create a new Jira issue contains 2 attachments of exact name, the following will happen:
- the Jira issue is successfully created and contains the 2 attachments (note that the filename of one attachment was modified by the mail handler with the extra "-1" at the end)
 !Bug_TicketCreated.png|thumbnail! 
- however, the Mail Processing logs from the page *⚙ > Applications > Email Requests* show the error "Unexpected error while running action as user '"
 !Bug_MailAuditLogs.png|thumbnail! 
- also, the following error is thrown in the Jira application logs:
{code}
2020-06-18 15:08:20,706+0200 Caesium-1-4 ERROR julien     [c.a.p.i.util.runner.AuthenticationContextUtilImpl] Unexpected error while running action as user 'julien'
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate key com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils$Attachment@6e4443db
	at java.util.stream.Collectors.lambda$throwingMerger$0(Collectors.java:133)
	at java.util.HashMap.merge(HashMap.java:1253)
	at java.util.stream.Collectors.lambda$toMap$58(Collectors.java:1320)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$3ReducingSink.accept(ReduceOps.java:169)
	at java.util.Spliterators$ArraySpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:948)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.IncomingEmailManagerImpl.postProcessIssueCreation(IncomingEmailManagerImpl.java:773)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.IncomingEmailManagerImpl.lambda$createIssueInJiraContext$22(IncomingEmailManagerImpl.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.pocketknife.step.EitherStep4.lambda$null$0(EitherStep4.java:29)
	at io.atlassian.fugue.Either$RightProjection.flatMap(Either.java:937)
	at io.atlassian.fugue.Either.flatMap(Either.java:231)
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Install a fresh Service Desk 4.8.0 instance
- Create a Service Desk project
- Configure a Service Desk Mail handler in *Project Settings > Email Requests*
- Send a new email to the mail handler, including 2 attachments of exact same name
--  (!) Note that the 2 files don't need to have the same content. Only the filename matters to replicate the bug

h3. Expected Results

A new ticket is created from this email and no error is thrown in the Mail Processing logs or Jira log file.

h3. Actual Results

A new ticket is created from this email and an error is thrown in the Mail Processing logs or Jira log file.

h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround 1

Remove any attachment with duplicate file name before sending an email to the Service Desk Mail Handler.

h4. Workaround 2

Disable the dark feature {{sd.email.attachments.store.duplicates}} by:
- Going to the page: <JIRA_BASE_URL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
- Adding {{sd.email.attachments.store.duplicates.disabled}} to the list of dark features, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !DarkFeature.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Important notes

This bug is similar to the bug JSDSERVER-6884, however:
- the steps to replicate it are different
- the fix implemented for this bug is different than for the other one, therefore the fix version is different for both bugs
- the workaround involving the dark feature *only works for this bug*, but not for the other one
fields.summary: Some incoming mails containing attachment are processed but trigger an error in the Mail Audit Logs

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The radio button field name in the customer portal has a different font size than other kind of fields. Other fields are set on 12px font size while radio button font size is 14px.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # add a radio button custom field 
 # add the radio button field to the field visible in the create issue form for a given request type on the customer portal
# open the customer portal and raise a request for the above request type
# observe that the font size for the radio button custom field name is bigger than the other fields name. In fact is 14px while the other ones are 12px:
 !Screenshot 2020-06-22 at 16.12.28.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
the font size should be equal for all fields name in customer portal
h3. Actual Results
font size is bigger for radio button field name
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wrong font size for radio buttons in customer portal
